title: What are the advantages and disadvantages of e-learning in an organisation? - Quora

response.answer_text: eLearning has already benefitted several organizations across industries. Yes, it has its own share of drawbacks. But I look them as problems to which there are solutions. Let me take you through them: Advantages: Enables learning anywhere, everywhere and on everythingIt’s cost effectiveNo physical infrastructure is neededAllows the enterprise to build a library of courses that serves as a repository for new and current employeesYou can create live as well as self-paced programs. Employees can work at their own pace and skip material they have already covered.Technological Possibilities: A lot of innovation is going on in eLearning and it is only going to become better with time. Problems/Disadvantages: Lack of control over trainingIsolated learning environmentNeed up-to-date technology in the organizationDifficult to operate for old employeesSolutions: Make your eLearning program interactive and interesting enough to hold the employees’ attention and have control over them.Technology update is not a drawback but the need of the era. You cannot update your employees without updating yourself.And there are e-learning solutions that are super user friendly. Just little training and employees of any age will have fun using it.Hope the answer was helpful.

All folks have access to the web and that we use it for several various things like researching for a few information for college and college projects, downloading music, pictures, to get updates on the latest happenings all over the world and we have many other things. But does one know there's another advantage of the web, which is through e-learning software? Yes! You can educate yourself within the comfort of your house and obtain a degree through the web now. With the newest technology, even the impossible seems possible now.  Advantages Of eLearning You will be able to link the various resources in several varying formats.It is a very efficient way of delivering courses online.Because of its convenience and flexibility, the resources are available from anywhere and at any time.The people, who are part-time students or are working full time, can take advantage of web-based learning.Web-based learning promotes active and independent learning.Until and unless you have access to the net, you can train yourself anytime and from anywhere also.It can turn out to be a convenient and flexible option; above all, you don't have to depend on anyone for anything.By this, Not only can you train yourself on a day to day basis, but also on weekends or whenever you have the free time to. There is no hard and fast rule.Using discussion boards and chats, you will be able to interact with everyone online and also clear your doubts if any.Whatever the instructions through a video that are provided for audio and video learning can be rewound and seen and heard again and again if you do not happen to understand the topic first time around.Disadvantages Of eLearning Well, there aren't many disadvantages of eLearning software like udemy clone, the most one being that you simply get knowledge only on a theoretical basis and when it involves putting to use whatever you have learned, it may be a little different. The face-to-face learning experience is missing, which can interest a number of you. The major of the online assessments are limited to questions that are only objective in nature.There is also the problem of the extent of the security of online learning programs.The originality of a particular student's work is also a problem as online just about anyone can do a project rather than the actual student itself.Whatever the evaluation that is computer marked generally has a tendency of being only knowledge-based and not necessarily practicality-based.
